problem:
Let $P(x)$ be the degree three polynomial with
\begin{align*}
P(12) &= \log 1, \\
P(13) &= \log 9, \\
P(14) &= \log 23, \\
P(15) &= \log 81.
\end{align*}Then $P(16)$ can be expressed in the form $A \log \frac{B}{C},$ where $A,$ $B,$ and $C$ are positive integers, and $C$ is prime.  Find $A + B + C.$
